intro: Pera incisa, commonly known as the cutleaf pera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its dissected, lobed leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The botanical features of Pera incisa make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
